intro: Phymatopsis conmixta, commonly known as the mixed phymatopsis, is a rare and elusive plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and limestone areas. Its small, white flowers bloom in late spring, and it is known for its unique ability to survive in extreme conditions. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Phymatopsis conmixta is considered a sensitive species in conservation efforts.
